1628.verse: قَالَتْ|She said,|81|95|2789$فَذَٲلِكُنَّ|"That|84|112|8957$ٱلَّذِى|(is) the one,|103|131|138$لُمْتُنَّنِى|you blamed me|119|147|8958$فِيهِ‌ۖ|about him.|90|118|32$وَلَقَدْ|And certainly|107|121|640$رَٲوَدتُّهُۥ|I sought to seduce him,|178|192|8959$عَن|[from]|61|89|1105$نَّفْسِهِۦ|[himself]|77|105|3094$فَٱسْتَعْصَمَ‌ۖ|but he saved himself,|162|190|8960$وَلَئِن|and if|66|94|1309$لَّمْ|not|42|56|63$يَفْعَلْ|he does|72|82|2038$مَآ|what|53|72|262$ءَامُرُهُۥ|I order him,|96|115|8961$لَيُسْجَنَنَّ|surely, he will be imprisoned|205|224|8962$وَلَيَكُونًا|and certainly will be|152|171|8963$مِّنَ|of|50|60|156$ٱلصَّـٰغِرِينَ|those who are disgraced."|193|193|6275$

1630.verse: فَٱسْتَجَابَ|So responded|110|117|3626$لَهُۥ|to him|61|74|977$رَبُّهُۥ|his Lord,|76|90|1128$فَصَرَفَ|and turned away|132|146|8970$عَنْهُ|from him|76|90|3938$كَيْدَهُنَّ‌ۚ|their plot.|85|98|8967$إِنَّهُۥ|Indeed, [He]|104|111|396$هُوَ|He|48|152|298$ٱلسَّمِيعُ|(is) All-Hearer,|117|324|1170$ٱلْعَلِيمُ|All-Knower.|95|199|342$

1631.verse: ثُمَّ|Then|53|64|293$بَدَا|(it) appeared|107|130|5515$لَهُم|to them|72|95|98$مِّنۢ بَعْدِ|after|91|114|280$مَا|[what]|65|88|262$رَأَوُاْ|they had seen|115|138|8193$ٱلْأَيَـٰتِ|the signs,|85|96|1099$لَيَسْجُنُنَّهُۥ|surely they should imprison him|226|306|8971$حَتَّىٰ|until|64|224|526$حِينٍ|a time.|66|146|390$

1633.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|86|309$لَا|"Not|48|75|30$يَأْتِيكُمَا|(will) come to both of you|193|220|8988$طَعَامٌ|food|70|97|8989$تُرْزَقَانِهِۦٓ|you are provided with|164|191|8990$إِلَّا|but|42|56|86$نَبَّأْتُكُمَا|I will inform both of you|177|187|8991$بِتَأْوِيلِهِۦ|of its interpretation,|154|174|8987$قَبْلَ|before|62|82|4626$أَن|[that]|60|80|655$يَأْتِيَكُمَا‌ۚ|[it] comes to both of you.|194|204|8992$ذَٲلِكُمَا|That|78|84|8993$مِمَّا|(is) of what|98|110|216$عَلَّمَنِى|has taught me|116|128|8994$رَبِّىٓ‌ۚ|my Lord.|77|89|2902$إِنِّى|Indeed, I|80|92|312$تَرَكْتُ|[I] abandon|98|110|8995$مِلَّةَ|(the) religion|105|111|1231$قَوْمٍ|(of) a people,|111|122|3192$لَّا|not|42|64|30$يُؤْمِنُونَ|they believe|101|123|35$بِٱللَّهِ|in Allah,|72|94|79$وَهُم|and they|79|101|256$بِٱلْأَخِرَةِ|in the Hereafter|125|147|824$هُمْ|[they]|62|73|49$كَـٰفِرُونَ|(are) disbelievers.|139|139|6416$

1627.verse: So when she heard of their scheming, she sent for them and prepared for them a banquet and gave each one of them a knife and said [to Joseph], "Come out before them." And when they saw him, they greatly admired him and cut their hands and said, "Perfect is Allah! This is not a man; this is none but a noble angel."

1628.verse: She said, "That is the one about whom you blamed me. And I certainly sought to seduce him, but he firmly refused; and if he will not do what I order him, he will surely be imprisoned and will be of those debased."

1629.verse: He said, "My Lord, prison is more to my liking than that to which they invite me. And if You do not avert from me their plan, I might incline toward them and [thus] be of the ignorant."

1630.verse: So his Lord responded to him and averted from him their plan. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

1631.verse: Then it appeared to them after they had seen the signs that al-'Azeez should surely imprison him for a time.

1632.verse: And there entered the prison with him two young men. One of them said, "Indeed, I have seen myself [in a dream] pressing wine." The other said, "Indeed, I have seen myself carrying upon my head [some] bread, from which the birds were eating. Inform us of its interpretation; indeed, we see you to be of those who do good."

1633.verse: He said, "You will not receive food that is provided to you except that I will inform you of its interpretation before it comes to you. That is from what my Lord has taught me. Indeed, I have left the religion of a people who do not believe in Allah, and they, in the Hereafter, are disbelievers.
